intro: Lychnophora trichocarpha, commonly known as the hairy-fruited lychnophora, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a dry, hairy capsule that contains several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
